title: 105+ Eid al-Fitr & Eid al-Adha Wishes & Greetings

steps.title: Share traditional Eid wishes to strike a formal and respectful tone.
steps.content: Share traditional Eid wishes to strike a formal and respectful tone. Using a more traditional Eid greeting is the perfect way to show respect to a devout Muslim friend. Use the list below to help someone celebrate the Eid festival: Remember this Eid that Allah walks beside you always. May Allah fill your heart with joy this Eid. May Allah guide you and light your path always. Eid Mubarak! Sending heartfelt Eid Mubarak greetings and sincere wishes for your happiness and well-being. Accept Allah with an open heart and mind this Eid. May blessings be with you and your family forever and always. Eid Mubarak! May Allah answer all of your prayers this Eid. On this blessed occasion, wishing peace and harmony for all. Eid Mubarak! Let your faith guide you this Eid and always.

steps.title: Use a more modern Eid greeting with people you know better.
steps.content: Use a more modern Eid greeting with people you know better. A cool greeting is the perfect way to wish your younger Muslim friend a happy Eid. Whether you use some hip slang terms or just want to go with a more casual vibe, we got you. Try out one of the modern greetings listed below: We are praying for your joy and health this Eid. May your Eid feast leave you full of faith as well as food. The wait is over! Eid is here. Time to celebrate, feast, and spread good cheer! I hope you make many happy memories this Eid. Sending Eid wishes your wayâ€”with extra sprinkles of joy and a side of happiness! May you feel the magic of Eid all year. Eid vibes and positive tribes. Celebrating with you in spirit! Let Eid fill your heart with love and your belly with deliciousness. Sending Eid smiles and hugs from miles away. Wishing you a blessed and joyous Eid!

steps.title: Keep your Eid wishes simple when you are unsure what to say.
steps.content: Keep your Eid wishes simple when you are unsure what to say. Simple Eid wishes can be just as meaningful as more elaborate ones. Theyâ€™re also especially good if you arenâ€™t sure what to say and just want to keep things easy. Try one of these straightforward wishes when Eid comes around: May your Eid be as amazing as Allah. We are so thankful for you this Eid! Eid reminds us that the greatest treasures aren't tangible. Your presence is a gift this Eid. On Eid, remember that Allah's presence is a gift. Place your trust in Allah this Eid. May Allah open all doors for you. Wishing you a vibrant and joyous Eid. May your bond with Allah grow even stronger this Eid.

steps.title: Wish them a happy Eid with a kind and considerate greeting.
steps.content: Wish them a happy Eid with a kind and considerate greeting. Not only does being kind and thoughtful help reduce stress and boost well-being, it also strengthens relationships. [1] X Research source Use one of the messages below to show someone you care about who they are and what they believe: I hope Eid brings you all the fun and festivity you deserve. May the only tears shed on Eid be those of joy and laughter. May Allah forgive our sins and acknowledge our sacrifices this Eid. Wishing you health and wealth this Eid. We hope Allah showers you and your loved ones with blessings. May all the light of heaven shine on you and your loved ones this Eid. This Eid, I hope you and your family feel Allah's warm presence bless your home. May you and your family be blessed with all the gifts of Allah this Eid. May we all remember this Eid to show forgiveness, speak for justice, and avoid the ignorant.

steps.title: Choose an uplifting message for your Eid greeting.
steps.content: Choose an uplifting message for your Eid greeting. An inspirational message is a great way to lift someoneâ€™s spirits and energize them for their Eid celebration. Not only do you help them celebrate, but you can also offer a little support and encouragement for the coming year. Here are a few inspirational Eid messages for you to choose from: Let this Eid be the most auspicious occasion to show your love and care for the people around you. Eid Mubarak to all! May Allah bless your days with joy, your weeks with prosperity, your months with happiness, and your years with love that never ends. Eid Mubarak! On this Eid, I pray for your health, happiness, and success. May Allah shower His blessings upon you and your family. Eid Mubarak! On this blessed day, be generous and thankful. Letâ€™s celebrate the joy of Eid by spreading joy and sharing with those who are less fortunate. May Allah flood your life with happiness on this occasion, your heart with love, your soul with spirituality, and your mind with wisdom! Wishing you a very Happy Eid. Eid Mubarak! Wishing you more opportunities and joyous moments in Eid and always. Let this Eid serve as a reflection for better days and a promise of new beginnings. Wishing you and your family a joyful Eid Mubarak! Let the festivities of Eid remind us of the greatness of Allah and the bonds we share with others. Eid Mubarak! May the blessings of Allah fill your life with happiness and open all doors of success now and always.

steps.title: Offer the appropriate Eid greeting for the end of Ramadan.
steps.content: Offer the appropriate Eid greeting for the end of Ramadan. While many Eid wishes can be used for Eid al-Fitr and Eid al-Adha, you can show even more respect for your loved oneâ€™s holiday by tailoring your greetings to the celebration of the end of the month of Ramadan. Try one of the happy Eid wishes below that are specifically for Eid al-Fitr: On the final day of Ramadan, may Allah answer your secret prayers, wipe away your secret tears, erase your secret fears, and lift you to the position you so dearly deserve. Wishing you good health, safety, and prosperity on this auspicious day of Eid al-Fitr. Celebrating the sweetness of Eid Al-Fitr after the blessed month of Ramadan. Eid Mubarak quotes for this special occasion! The moon has been sighted! Eid Al-Fitr Mubarak to you and your loved ones. The fasting is complete. Now comes the feast! Happy Eid Al-Fitr! May the spirit of Ramadan stay in our hearts and illuminate our way. Eid Al-Fitr greetings to you and yours! Eid al-Fitr Mubarak! May all the devotion you had in your heart during the holy month of Ramadan bring great joy to you on this Eid al-Fitr day. Wishing you and your family a blessed Eid al-Fitr! May the Almighty Allah accept all your good deeds during the month of Ramadan. After a month of fasting and reflection, may your Eid Al-Fitr be filled with joy and blessings.

Wishing you a meaningful Eid Al-Adha. May the sacrifice of Eid al Adha remind you of Godâ€™s Mercy.

steps.title: Eid al-Fitr marks the end of the holy month of Ramadan.
steps.content: Eid al-Fitr marks the end of the holy month of Ramadan. Eid al-Fitr means â€œFestival of the Breaking the Fast.â€ According to Mohsin, Eid al-Fitr is the first day of the lunar month of Shawwal after observing Ramadan, a month of fasting and prayer. The fasting during Ramadan allows Muslims to become closer to Allah and focus on their faith. Eid marks the end of fasting and gives believers the opportunity to thank Allah for the strength they had throughout Ramadan. [7] X Research source The beginning of Eid comes with the new moon but can vary based on where in the world people are celebrating. Religious authorities may set the beginning of Eid in their area on different days. [8] X Research source Mohsin says that Eid al-Fitr can happen at any time of the Gregorian year because itâ€™s based on the Islamic lunar calendar. The date changes from year to year. Some Muslim countries have official government holidays that last 3 days or more for Eid. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Eid al-Adha marks the climax of the Hajj or pilgrimage.
steps.content: Eid al-Adha marks the climax of the Hajj or pilgrimage. Eid al-Adha means â€œFeast of the Sacrifice.â€ Itâ€™s a holiday that Muslims celebrate after the Hajj , or a pilgrimage to Mecca. This celebration commemorates Ibrahimâ€™s willingness to sacrifice his son Ismail. [10] X Research source Eid al-Adha usually happens on the 10th day of the Islamic lunar month of Dhul Hijjah and falls about 10 weeks after Eid al-Fitr, but it can vary. [11] X Research source Mohsin explains that Eid al-Adha (like Eid al-Fitr) is based on the lunar calendar, so it doesnâ€™t fall on the same day as the Western or Gregorian calendar every year.

steps.title: Muslims celebrate Eid al-Fitr with prayer, feasting, and gift-giving.
steps.content: Muslims celebrate Eid al-Fitr with prayer, feasting, and gift-giving. Because Eid al-Fitr comes at the end of a fast, feasting and eating sweets are common ways to celebrate. Itâ€™s often referred to as the â€œSweet Holidayâ€ because people eat sweet foods like dates, halwa, falooda, cookies with milk, and baklava. [12] X Research source Mosques often offer sweet foods for people to eat before or after prayer. In fact, people are not allowed to fast during Eid! Traditionally, people perform ghusl , or take a ceremonial shower or bath before attending prayers during Eid. They may also put on their best clothes or buy new clothes and wear colognes or perfumes to present their best selves. [13] X Research source In South Asia, Muslim women also may decorate their skin with henna the evening before Eid. Once people have broken their fast and gotten dressed, they are encouraged to participate in Eid prayers and spend time with family.

steps.title: Eid al-Adha is celebrated with prayer, animal sacrifice, and feasting.
steps.content: Eid al-Adha is celebrated with prayer, animal sacrifice, and feasting. Many Muslims, especially men, attend an Eid prayer and sermon early in the morning on Eid al-Adha. Much like Eid al-Fitr, people bathe in the morning and dress well for the day. After prayer, people visit with family and friends to exchange food and gifts. [14] X Research source The sacrifice of a sheep or goat in accordance with halal is an important part of the Eid al-Adha celebration as a symbol of Ibrahimâ€™s sacrifice to Allah. Halal is something that is permissible according to Islamic law. One-third of the sacrificed animal is eaten by the people who sacrificed it, â…“ is given to extended family and friends, and the final â…“ is given to the poor. If someone canâ€™t make a sacrifice, itâ€™s common for them to send money to someone who can, use a butcher, or make a charitable donation. [15] X Research source

steps.content: Is it okay for a non-Muslim to say â€œEid Mubarakâ€? Yes, itâ€™s perfectly okay, and even welcome, for non-Muslims to share happy Eid wishes with their Muslim friends, colleagues, and family members. You could even give them a gift or take part in the festivities! [16] X Research source

steps.title: How should you reply when someone says â€œEid Mubarakâ€?
steps.content: How should you reply when someone says â€œEid Mubarakâ€? There are several phrases you can say when someone wishes you, â€œEid Mubarak.â€ The most direct would be, â€œEid Mubarak to you, too!â€ Another polite response would be, â€œKhair Mubarak,â€ which roughly translates to â€œMay you have blessed goodness.â€ [17] X Research source You could also say, â€œJazakAllah Khair,â€ meaning â€œMay Allah reward you with goodness.â€

steps.title: What are other ways to give someone happy Eid wishes?
steps.content: What are other ways to give someone happy Eid wishes? Send them a text or email with one of the Eid wishes in this article. Or, send or make them an Eid cardâ€”digital or physical. Imagery associated with Islam is common on Eid cards, including crescent moons, stars, mosques, lanterns, and Arabic-style calligraphy. [18] X Research source Eid is often celebrated with family and friends, so images of people feasting together are also appropriate. Feasting is an important part of Eid festivities, so images of food are also good choices for Eid cards and wishes.
